definition: alone/lonely
lone/lonely
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
lit. a lonely body with only a shadow for company/to be all alone (idiom)

sentences.english: In restless dreams I walked alone narrow streets of cobblestone, neath the hallo of a street lamp.
sentences.chinese: 紛亂的夢中我孤身一人，走在鋪滿圓石的狹窄小徑。

sentences.english: I'm alone, bue I'm not lonely.
sentences.chinese: 我孤身一人，但我並不孤獨。

sentences.english: Now Mazarin was alone and defenseless, as he well knew.
sentences.chinese: 現在，馬薩林孤身一人，手無寸鐵，他也知道。

sentences.english: Now Max and maggie only alone combat.
sentences.chinese: 現在馬克斯與瑪吉只能孤身作戰了。

sentences.english: Most people I see voting go to the polls alone.
sentences.chinese: 我看到的大多數人都是孤身前去投票。

sentences.english: Years of living alone may warp one's personality.
sentences.chinese: 長期的孤身生活會使人的性格變得乖戾。

sentences.english: In the story, he had left her stranded in a K-Mart all by herself, while she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 故事中，他拋下懷孕的她孤身一人困在沃爾瑪。

sentences.english: And let me be alone again.
For now, IKEA and the lonely hearts are in an uneasy truce.
sentences.chinese: 現在，宜家公司與孤身人們仍然處於緊張的休戰階段。

sentences.english: Ge, one of the lonely hearts, admits they don't treat the company very well.
sentences.chinese: 其中一名孤身人，承認他們對公司的做法並不太適宜。

sentences.english: I was gradually being left alone.
sentences.chinese: 漸漸地就剩下我孤身一人了。

sentences.english: What if I end up alone?
sentences.chinese: 最後我孤身一人怎麼辦？

sentences.english: He is all alone without a companion.
In small qian alone, in the mountain thief, entanglement between pushed the sea.
sentences.chinese: 就在小倩孤身一人之際，遇上山賊，糾纏間被推下海。

sentences.english: There is a lot of competition all year and you play alone.
sentences.chinese: 一年下來有大量的比賽，而你要孤身奮戰。

definition: alone/by oneself
unmarried/single
single-handedly (idiom)
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
solitary
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
enemy camp
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to travel around the country
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
critical circumstances/risky conditions/danger zone
to be on one's own/to be left alone/to be left out
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
to travel far/distant wanderings
